poem:
**Threads and Fibers**

In hands where time tangles,  
thatch whispers a fading dialect,  
fibers crossed in stories, unpinned  
from their lands. The violins weep  
a silent tune, wooden echoes  
craving their touch. Crafts unravel,  
slipping the grasp of the steady craftsperson,  
lost in language not of ropes  
but of heartstrings, tightening  
to the tremble of an old song.
